message:
Hey guys,

This is my first post ever here, hope to make some friends :)

Anyway, you all know about SaaS solutions, i was wondering; is there is ANY Arabic SaaS apps ? I keep saying to myself "Well, of course there are, many", but nothing ever pop up to me online!

I just finished one BTW, it's called "Tamkeen", it's a learning management Web App for training centers/academies, delivered as an online service.

Hope you have sometime to check it out and give me your feedback :) 

tamkeenlms.com

The #1 problem i am facing in MENA is that people are not open minded enough about the idea itself, i always get this from clients: "ammm ... and MY DATA will be on your servers! "

SaaS solutions are just awesome for both the customer and the provider, but how can we help push the trust of the targeted customers to accept it and see its pros ?! Any one has any expertise in this area ?

data.message:
http://www.manshar.org/
is sort of SaaS app for authors and writers and whoever want to scratch anything online.
you can consider it as the Arabian Medium.
 
basically, the Arabian clients will have more concerns about how much will they pay for both 1 - developing and getting the product ready, 2 - the operational phase ; hosting, supporting, maintenance etc..
the cloud still expensive, forget about heroku and the cheap dyno thing, once your database record's exceed the default amount, they will charge you more, they still the cheapest competitor I guess right there. anyway, the client still demands to not throw lots of cash on things he can't even understand.
IMHO, you should be picky with your clients if you want to use the cloud instead of shared hosts.
or use the shared host solutions for the فلاحين as I see lots of them want the كلشن كان work. - RACISM is not my normal attitude, but fuck it's true - 
at the end, every thing in this discipline is a matter of tweaking the best/cheap - in price not value/ affordable/meaningful thing for the job.
forgive any typos مش هصلح حاجة أنا في الرط ده كله
define arabic? .. you mean built by arabs? if so, Instabug "Instantly" comes to mind :) ..
Definitely Instabug came to my mind

you also have Fawry, Payment Processing as a Service. 
but true there aren't many out there ..
